alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:14AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clayton and Allamakee counties in northeast Iowa and Crawford County in southwest Wisconsin through 915 AM CDT... At 808 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Allamakee County in northeast Iowa and Crawford County in southwest Wisconsin. These storms are moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, frequent lightning, and hourly rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches which may cause localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
